Youtube Guide # What you’ll need for this guide # Item Description Download link Stove Client Official client to play the game on Linux. Download here Microsoft Edge WebView2 Runtime required by Stove (provides the web‑view component). Get it from Microsoft here Heroic Games Launcher Front‑end for installing and launching games on Linux. Install via Flathub Important:
Download the Evergreen Bootstrapper for Microsoft Edge WebView2 and save it to your Downloads folder Download the Stove Client use link above or search engine 2️⃣ Open the Heroic Games Launcher # Stop the launcher on Heroic Game if you already encounted the bug Right‑click the Chaos Zero Nightmare entry in Heroic and choose Settings. In Wine version, pick Proton‑GE (or Proton CachyOS – both work fine) if not done already. 3️⃣ Enable Wine Wayland (fixes the “install frozen” bug) # Try this fix first unless you know you are on X11 or Linux Mint.
Enable it by pressing the box then open the game should be fixed.
Alternate method – for X11/Linux Mint(not using Wayland)users # If you’re running an X11 session (i3, XFCE, Qtile, dwm, Linux Mint, etc.) the following steps apply:
Open Settings → WINECFG (Wine configuration). Click Install to open the configuration window. Go to the Graphics tab. Check Emulate virtual desktop and adjust the size if desired. Click Apply, then OK. 4️⃣ Launch the game # Start Chaos Zero Nightmare from Heroic (or whatever launcher you use).
The installation‑freeze bug should no longer appear.
If you need to revert the changes, simply uncheck the “Emulate virtual desktop” box or disable Wine Wayland again.
5️⃣ Lutris – enabling Wine Wayland # Open your Lutris settings for the game. Add the environment variable: PROTON_ENABLE_WAYLAND=1 Save and launch. 6️⃣ Lutris – enabling a virtual desktop # To get into Wine Config on Lutris just select the game and press the arrow to reveal the menu.Select wine configuration
…and then enable Emulate virtual desktop in the Wine configuration (same screenshots as step 3).

YouTube Guide (Heroic Games is having Issues after Season 2 update) – video will be replaced soon # What you’ll need # Item Description Download link Stove Client Official client to play the game on Linux. Download here Microsoft Edge WebView2 Runtime required by Stove (provides the web‑view component). Get it from Microsoft here Fuagus Launcher Front‑end for installing and launching games on Linux. Install via Flathub Important
Download the evergreen bootstrapper for Microsoft Edge WebView2 and save it to your Downloads folder.
Then download the Stove client using the link above or a search engine.
1️⃣ Fuagus Launcher: Quick Start # Open Fuagus Launcher.
Go to Settings → Proton Manager and download the latest available Proton.
Click the + button, add the name of the game, then click the search icon and locate the STOVE.exe you downloaded earlier.
Set Proton to the version you downloaded, then press OK.
Click Play – Stove will install quickly, accepting terms and defaults.
Once Stove finished installing: Right‑click the CZN entry in Fuagus Launcher, choose Edit, then click Run and locate your Microsoft Edge WebView evergreen bootstrapper executable.
2️⃣ Wayland‑Friendly Setup # After installing WebView, most users can simply enable Wayland by adding the following launch argument:
PROTON_ENABLE_WAYLAND=1 If you already enabled Wayland in your settings, skip to Launch Stove from Fuagus.
3️⃣ X11 / Linux‑Mint Workaround # For users on an X11 session (i3, XFCE, Qtile, dwm, Linux Mint, etc.) follow these steps instead of enabling Wayland:
Open Tools → WINECFG (Wine configuration).
Click Install to open the configuration window.
Go to the Graphics tab.
Check Emulate virtual desktop and adjust the size if desired.
Click Apply, then OK.
4️⃣ Launch Stove from Fuagus # Copy the prefix path you used when installing Stove and paste it into the Prefix box.
Then click Search and locate your STOVE.exe. It will look something like:
/home/user/Fuagus/prefix_name/drive_c/ProgramData/Smilegate/STOVE/STOVE.exe or, if you’re using a custom prefix folder:
/home/frost/Faugus/czn2/drive_c/ProgramData/Smilegate/STOVE/STOVE.exe Once the executable is found, click Run to start Stove.
Happy gaming!

1. Required Applications # 1. Steam # 2. Uma Musume # 3. Try to play the game (should work out of the box) # 2. If you have a white screen bug # Open a terminal and paste the following command
killall steam # closes steam if it is open steam steam://unlockh264/ #fixes videos not playing which is why white screen bug Game should work now
3. If that fails then # Can follow the video guide
ProtonPlus # Install ProtonPlus from Flathub:
https://flathub.org/en/apps/com.vysp3r.ProtonPlus
Or search for ProtonPlus in your software/app manager.
Open ProtonPlus # Download the latest Proton-GE after selecting Steam in top left
Set Umamusume to use Proton-GE Latest in Compatbility in ProtonPlus # Go on the Games section on ProtonPlus and set Uma to use Proton-GE All done can play now with best compability settings
Alternative Steps # Still had to have followed the steps to isntall Proton-GE on Steam first
Set Umamusume to use Proton-GE Latest in Compatbility in Steam # Press the cog icon on your Steam for Uma Musame Go into Compability and select Proton-GE
Can use Proton-CachyOS aswell
Enjoy the game # Side hint not a bad idea to set all Steam Games to your Proton-GE or Proton-CachyOS # If you need to use a specific one or even a different one can always set that per game Select Steam then Settings in top left of Steam
Set default to use Proton-GE Latest in Compatbility # Now every game on Steam will use Proton-GE by default no more setup. Go into Compability and select Proton-GE
Enjoy the game and your other games #

Updated Guide for the Steam Release as of 02/02/2026 # Still Usable but harder method (use Steam if you can) # We need to get bbe installed on our Linux Desktops System # Steam Deck users would need another video/guide but my discord server does have a good guide and help section using the Universal Method.Will ipload that here soon. # Install bbe on Ubuntu/Debian Distros # Using a debian/ubuntu based distro (Linux Mint,Ubuntu,Debian,,PopOS,PikaOS,Zorin)
To install the Binary Block Editor (bbe) on Ubuntu, run:
sudo apt update sudo apt install bbe Install bbe on Arch via yay # Using an Arch based distro(Arch,CachyOS,EndevourOS, I know you know you’re on Arch)
(not Steam Deck check PGR discord or Steam Deck/Univseral Guide that will covered soon if not already)
This package is installed form Arch User Repo
https://aur.archlinux.org/packages/bbe
sudo pacman -S yay yay -S bbe Install bbe on Fedora via COPR # Using a Fedora based distro (Fedora,Nobara,ect)
Will be using this copr package to install BBE
https://copr.fedorainfracloud.org/coprs/adrianl40/bbe/
Enable the COPR repo:
sudo dnf copr enable adrianl40/bbe sudo dnf install bbe Confirm BBE is installed # After installed confirm with:
bbe --version Fixing the Launcher to not be Transparent after installed with Proton/Wine Runner # Open a terminal inside that directory (should be the version directory where the name is a version number) Paste this command in:
mv launcher_main.dll launcher_main.dll.bak bbe -e "s/\x12AllowsTransparency/\x09IsEnabled\x1bA\x00\x03AAAAA/" launcher_main.dll.bak > launcher_main.dll This is a the same as the command above just split up. You have to add the path of the launcher_maill.dll yourself.
mv "/path/to/Punishing Gray Raven/#.#.#.#/launcher_main.dll" "/path/to/Punishing Gray Raven/#.#.#.#/launcher_main.dll.bak" bbe -e "s/\x12AllowsTransparency/\x09IsEnabled\x1bA\x00\x03AAAAA/" "/path/to/Punishing Gray Raven/#.#.#.#/launcher_main.dll.bak" > "/path/to/Punishing Gray Raven/#.#.#.#/launcher_main.dll" This does not alter the game in any way! It simply disables Transparency inside the launcher to allow the launcher to render.
